definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: We may call this phenomenon catching the lion by its tail, and it is an unskillful thing to do.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以称之为抓住狮子的尾巴，这是不善巧的。

sentences.english: It was low growing, with a bow just high enough to catch her.
sentences.chinese: 它是低增长，只是高要抓住她的弓。

sentences.english: Young scene seize turned separate yeongjo, want to notice him about plucking exceedingly senti-mental secrets.
sentences.chinese: 幼景抓住转身分开的英祖，要通知他关于寒星的机密。

sentences.english: The man always holds woman's hand closely to grasp.
sentences.chinese: 男亽始终抓住女亽旳掱紧紧握著。

sentences.english: I killed someone, so I had to go. Otherwise I would be captured and sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 杀了人，我害怕被警察抓住判刑枪毙。

sentences.english: He jumped onto the table, turned over the cage tried to catch me.
sentences.chinese: 它跳上桌子，把笼子掀倒，企图抓住我。

sentences.english: The police apprehended her and took her away.
sentences.chinese: 警察还是抓住了她，把她带走了。

sentences.english: E. g. : The thief was caught red-handed just as he was putting the watch in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 当小偷把表放进口袋里时，他被当场抓住了。

sentences.english: The man was caught red-handed in robbery.
sentences.chinese: 那个人在抢劫时被当场抓住。

sentences.english: She tried to disengage herself from his grip.
sentences.chinese: 她企图挣脱他的牢牢抓住的手。

sentences.english: Take advantage of every loss to improve your knowledge of mar ket action.
sentences.chinese: 抓住每一次赔钱的机会，改进你对市场行为的了解。

sentences.english: The robber was captured and disarmed.
sentences.chinese: 那个抢劫犯被抓住了，并被缴了械。
马车停下来，他被抓住了。

sentences.english: Does Glyn go to catch the man who has been selling fake potions?
sentences.chinese: 葛林会去抓住那个卖假药的人吗？

sentences.english: In the distance, a woman grasped a handful of green incense and carefully lit it.
sentences.chinese: 在远处，一个女人抓住了一把绿香小心把它点燃。

definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
to observe and make sure/to check
to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
to catch up with/to keep pace with
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to come across/to run into/to meet/to hit
